page.title: 04ROADS AND PATHS, WEST CAMBS.
page.content:
Two roads cross the area from North to South: the B66O, leading from the Al through Catworth to Kimbolton; and a minor road from the A6O4 through Spaldwick and Stow Longa to Kimbolton and the A45. Apart from the hamlet of Little Catworth, all the housing in the area lies close to these roads, and residents are within easy reach of the country's motorway network.
Access to the land between the two roads is provided by farm tracks, public footpaths and bridleways. Most of these remain in use, although the sign-posting of paths and bridleways in the area is generally poor. A few minor footpaths have fallen into disuse, either as a result of modern farming methods, or because they no longer fulfil a local need.
